D1.label: Iron Ore Cash Generation — Pilbara Delivers
D1.description: Iron Ore Cash Generation — Pilbara Delivers
D1.plain_english: Rio's Pilbara iron ore system is the world's lowest-cost major operation, generating exceptional cash flow at current prices.
D1.what_to_watch: Iron ore prices, Pilbara shipment volumes, C1 cost trajectory.
D1.upside: Material re-rating if iron ore prices sustain above US$100/t and copper ramp accelerates.
D1.risk_plain: If iron ore breaks below US$90/t, earnings compress significantly.

D2.label: Energy Transition Portfolio — Copper and Lithium Optionality
D2.description: Energy Transition Portfolio — Copper and Lithium Optionality
D2.plain_english: Rio is building significant positions in copper (Oyu Tolgoi) and lithium (Arcadium) for the energy transition.
D2.what_to_watch: Oyu Tolgoi ramp-up progress, copper prices, Arcadium integration, lithium price recovery.
D2.upside: If copper and lithium contribute 30-40% of EBITDA by 2030, significant re-rating potential.
D2.risk_plain: If growth projects face cost overruns or commodity prices remain depressed, capital is destroyed.

D3.label: China Demand Slowdown — Property Sector Drag
D3.description: China Demand Slowdown — Property Sector Drag
D3.plain_english: China's property sector downturn reduces steel and iron ore demand structurally.
D3.what_to_watch: China steel production, property sector starts, iron ore port inventories.
D3.risk_plain: If China steel production declines below 950Mtpa, iron ore prices could break below US$80/t.

D4.label: Growth Capex Risk — Simandou and Arcadium Execution
D4.description: Growth Capex Risk — Simandou and Arcadium Execution
D4.plain_english: Over US$15B in growth capital committed to Simandou, Arcadium, and Oyu Tolgoi carries execution risk.
D4.what_to_watch: Simandou first ore timing, Arcadium impairment testing, total capex vs free cash flow.
D4.risk_plain: If project execution falters, capital deployed destroys value and shareholder returns are reduced.

big_picture: CY2024 results delivered underlying earnings of US$11.8B (down 3%) on revenue of US$53.7B. The Pilbara iron ore system shipped 328Mt at C1 costs of US$21.7/t, maintaining world-leading margins. EBITDA margin was 39%. Net debt is a conservative US$5.5B (0.5x EBITDA). The dividend of US$3.41/share (60% payout) yields ~5.4%. However, the thesis is increasingly bifurcated: the iron ore cash machine is well-understood and fairly valued, while the growth portfolio (copper via Oyu Tolgoi, lithium via Arcadium, iron ore via Simandou) carries significant execution risk. At ~10x forward P/E, the market is pricing the cash flows but discounting the growth optionality.
